forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind around 25 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 18 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco presents a picture of clarity and warmth beneath a vast expanse of blue. As the sun bathes the city in gentle light, temperatures hover around a comfortable 63 degrees, gradually easing toward 60 as the daylight softens. The western winds, brisk at approximately 25 mph, add a lively energy to the atmosphere, carrying the faintest hint of salt from the bay that defines the region. This delightful combination invites one to take in the sights—the city’s storied skyline standing tall against a backdrop of open sky, with not a trace of fog to mar the view.

As evening approaches, the air cools to a refreshing 50 degrees, ushered in by winds that shift slightly but remain persuasively cool. The forecast predicts a partly cloudy night, but for now, it is a time to revel in the remaining daylight. Dressing in layers is wise; a light jacket will suffice against the westerly winds, particularly if you intend to stay outside as dusk deepens. With the day still young, a stroll along the waterfront or through one of the city's charming neighborhoods beckons. This is an ideal moment to seek out a quaint café for a soothing cup of tea, or to explore a vibrant street fair if any local events are gracing you this afternoon. Such enjoyment under the beautiful skies fosters an appreciation for the simple pleasures of urban life, made all the sweeter by today’s lovely climate.
